name: Sample Player (Clocked)
description: This algorithm plays samples synced to a clock input, stretching or shrinking them to fit the tempo provided by the clock. It is the spiritual successor to the disting mk4 Clocked Audio Playback algorithm but works somewhat differently. The Sample Player (Clocked) recalculates playback speed based on the chosen sample's length and the current tempo/time signature, adjusting it to fit a calculated number of bars. Parameters like 'Speed tune' allow manual adjustments for accuracy when samples don't perfectly align with bar counts.
short_description: Plays samples synced to a clock
use_cases: Looping samples in time with MIDI or external clocks
Adjusting playback speed for tempo synchronization
Triggering samples via bus, MIDI, or manual controls
Automated sample triggering in fixed intervals or loop-based timing
gui_description: Displays the waveform of the chosen sample, updated during playback. Shows tick marks for bars and beats above the waveform. To the right, it displays the sample length (in seconds), natural bar count at original speed, and adjusted bar count based on clocked tempo. The interface highlights how the sample fits into the calculated loop time.

specifications.name: Record time
specifications.description: The maximum length of audio that can be recorded (sampled).

input_ports.name: Clock input
input_ports.description: The bus to use as the clock input for tempo synchronization.

input_ports.name: Reset input
input_ports.description: The bus to use as the reset input, which can trigger or stop/restart playback depending on 'Reset mode'.
